entry.title: G299.2-2.9 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that G299.2-2.9 (pictured) is one of the oldest known Type Ia supernova remnants in the Milky Way?

entry.title: Camberley Kate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that eccentric Yorkshirewoman Camberley Kate is estimated to have cared for more than 600 dogs in her lifetime?

entry.title: Chronicles from the Land of the Happiest People on Earth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chronicles from the Land of the Happiest People on Earth was Wole Soyinka's first novel in nearly fifty years?

entry.title: William O'Rourke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that cricketer William O'Rourke has the best match-bowling figures by a New Zealander on a Test debut?

entry.title: Biodiversity Impact Credits (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Biodiversity Impact Credits seek to stop species extinction?

entry.title: Palestinian press (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the terms "Palestine" and "Palestinians" were being increasingly used in 1908 by the emergent Palestinian press, which expressed anti-Zionist positions?

entry.title: Cameron Butler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that ice hockey player Cameron Butler "had the good fortune not to get pulled over as he raced" to reach his team's game in time for his NHL debut?

entry.title: And He Shall Be a Good Man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the iZombie episode "And He Shall Be a Good Man" gets its name from an Elton John lyric?

entry.title: Sans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sans's boss theme, "Megalovania", was played at the Vatican as part of a circus act during an audience with Pope Francis?
